House of the Year Awards 2023: Waikato housing developments win accolades https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/house-of-the-year-awards-2023-waikato-housing-developments-win-accolades/AQPNU64MAFHWRI6ZFDTGGWLYTM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/news/house-of-the-year-awards-2023-waikato-housing-developments-win-accolades/AQPNU64MAFHWRI6ZFDTGGWLYTM/ A Cooks Beach home featuring local stone is one of three winning Waikato properties. Mon, 27 Nov 2023 01:38:56 +0000 the Supreme House of the Year under $1 million Award went to this development in Raglan, built by FV Design and Build. The house also took out the New Home Award in the $750,000 - $1 million category. Photo / Troy Constable
Far North aged care providers rally to ‘grow their own workforce’ as retirement villages mushroom https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-ged-care-providers-rally-to-grow-their-own-workforce-as-retirement-villages-mushroom/DR74UJ3AA5A5LMUGD3TT2A5PBA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/far-north-ged-care-providers-rally-to-grow-their-own-workforce-as-retirement-villages-mushroom/DR74UJ3AA5A5LMUGD3TT2A5PBA/ Jenny LingFar North aged care facilities find solution to recruit staff in a region of high demand. Mon, 27 Nov 2023 01:38:13 +0000 Kerikeri Retirement Village chief executive Hilary Sumpter said a lack of trained staff could undermine the provision of 150 extra aged care beds planned for the mid-north.
State Highway 2 reopens near Wairoa after slip claims a life during weekend’s bad weather https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/state-highway-2-reopens-near-wairoa-after-slip-claims-a-life-during-weekends-bad-weather/UHJ7FYJNKRHQNE63RC4SVANB6I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/state-highway-2-reopens-near-wairoa-after-slip-claims-a-life-during-weekends-bad-weather/UHJ7FYJNKRHQNE63RC4SVANB6I/ One person died and another was seriously injured after crashing into the slip. Mon, 27 Nov 2023 01:37:31 +0000 The slip site where a person died in a motor vehicle incident on State Highway 2 south of Wairoa on Sunday morning. Photo / Paul Taylor.
